attributes.comment:
I am writing to object to the proposed increase in adoption-related pettion fees.
First of all, adoption is an outrageously long and expensive enough a process
already, without increasing the fees.

Second, it is objectionable to me that my wife and I have already paid a large sum
of money to the USCIS in fees, and that, through delays that are no fault of mine,
and the expiry of USCIS-imposed time limits, we will be forced to pay for the same
thing all over again, only this time at an even higher rate.

My wife and I are currently trying to adopt from China, which is taking at least 16
months to complete the process from the date of receipt of paperwork. USCIS
adoption petitions last only 12 months. I am incensed enough about paying twice
(maybe even 3 times, who knows) for the same thing; I am certainly not interested
in paying even higher fees for something for which I have already paid.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Timothy Moran
